projects.name: Angular Contacts
projects.description: A contacts app which allows the user to view, add, favorite and delete contacts.

projects.name: Angular Movie History
projects.description: This was a class project which introduced the use of API's to search a live database of movie information.

projects.name: Team Treehouse Badges
projects.description: This was an inclass exercise to quickly build file structure, retreive your awarded badges and have them print to the page.

projects.name: My Warranty Pal App
projects.description: An app used to track all warranties related to daily life.

projects.name: Sandwichbuilder
projects.description: Browserify project which allows the user to build a custom sandwich and each selected item is totalled at the end.

projects.name: Dynamic Cards
projects.description: This was a class project we completed in August, 2017.  I have displayed it here to show how far I have come in four months.

blogs.title: My Blog 1
blogs.content: We are to set up our personal site using Github. We will be adding to this site as the course progresses.  I am very much overwhelmed with Terminal and Github.

blogs.title: My Blog 2
blogs.content: On our personal site, we were required to create two additional pages, Projects and About Me.  I have successfully made the links but my navigation from one to another is not working.

blogs.title: My Blog 3
blogs.content: We have been learning CSS and boy.  I feel like I have no clue how to do this.  Our website is also required to have our blog post created

blogs.title: My Blog 4
blogs.content: We completed a group project named Dynamic Cards.  We used JS and CSS for this project and I was able to create cards which printed to the page and that could be altered using event listeners such as 'onclick'.

blogs.title: My Blog 5
blogs.content: We have complete two additional projects since my last blog.  Both used JS and CSS.  While I am still struggling, I do feel that I am gaining a better grasp.

blogs.title: My Blog 6
blogs.content: We have been introduced to Bootstrap and I think that it makes some things easier.  We have deployed Bootstrap to our personal sites.

blogs.title: My Blog 7
blogs.content: I completed the sandwichbuilder project.  The app allows the user to build a custom sandwich and adds the total of each selected item at the end.  Bootstrap was used on this project also.

blogs.title: My Blog 8
blogs.content: Jquery.  This has been my first exposure to jquery and I am not sure how I feel about it.  I will work with it some more and update.  To be continued...

blogs.title: My Blog 9
blogs.content: API's: we have been working with API's.  If done correctly, they are powerful banks of information.  We have used a API to build an app which allows one to search The Movie Database for specific movie information.  Its pretty awesome when I finally got it working.

blogs.title: My Blog 10
blogs.content: Firebase: We have set up a Firebase service to deploy our projects from.  We no longer have to use our computer as the host server.  I do not totally understand how this works but I will address it again in another blog.

blogs.title: My Blog 11
blogs.content: Angular:  I love it.  This is the first program that truely makes sense to me.  There are positives and negatives to anything.  The negatives: Lots of controllers and partials.  I constantly forget to add the new controllers to my index page which makes the whole site crash.

blogs.title: My Blog 12
blogs.content: My capstone project has been approved as I have finally finished Angular Contacts.  I am going to produce an app which allows one to track all warranties related to all aspects of their lives; electronics, vehicles, appliances, etc.  I will be using Angular and Bootstrap and deploying from Firebase.
